content.description: Second climb (left to right) on the wall.  Climb above bolt 1 to an insecure position and reach up into a good undercling where you can clip bolt 2.  Belay beware of close-lining your leader on a fall above bolt one!  Strenuous moves out of the large hueco leads to more moderate terrain above.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Second route from the left, see original topo.

content.description: Slabby limestone with large pockets and huecos.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on The Butt wall.  This route is also just right of the access scramble that leads to camp.

content.description: An area classic!  Cleavage offers bouldery opening moves on steep terrain with a solid no hands rest before the crux section.  Good clips throughout the entire climb, with a committing move between B4 to B5.  Clip B5 with a good right hand hold.  Better for the belayer to pay out a little extra slack here, so as not to whip the leader's torso into the bulge. It eases up a bit near the top, but it's not really over until the chains!
content.protection: 6 bolts plus a 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Climb is left of the Butt Crack, starting in a low horizontal crack (the butt cleavage) up a vertical crack into a roof corner and then out right through a large hueco which looks like an old bee hive.  See topo.

content.description: The bottom of the route is slabby and thin.  The route has a couple difficult transitional moves into the crack.  The crack itself is a sharp, positive hand crack that lends itself well to layback moves.
content.protection: Chain anchors that are accessible from the top. The crack will probably take small to medium gear.
content.location: This route is probably the most prominent feature feature on The Butt wall.

content.description: The Butt is home to some of the best pocketed overhang climbing on the Ranch.  Most of the routes' anchors are accessible from the top including the TR/trad line Butt Crack 5.10.  Besides the left most line Half Monty 5.9 and Unclench 5.10+ the rest of the wall is 5.12.  Enjoy shade all morning and the shortest approach of any wall on the ranch.
